Data.event_text: - Central Statistics Office estimates GDP Growth at 6.5% for the 201718 financial year, compared to 7.1% for the previous year. The estimates quote the effects of GST transition and agrarian distress for the slowest growth in four years and forecast growth to pick up in the next year.

links.text: -"GDP growth may slow down to 6.5% in FY18". The Economic Times. 2018. Retrieved January 6, 2018.-
-"GDP growth seen slowing to 4-year low of 6.5% in 2017–18". The Hindu. January 5, 2018. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved January 6, 2018.-
-"GDP growth seen slowing to 4-year low of 6.5% in 2017–18". The Hindu. January 5, 2018. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved January 6, 2018.-

Data.event_text: 11 people died in an avalanche in Kupwara district of Jammu and Kashmir.

links.text: -"11 killed in avalanche in north Kashmir's Kupwara district". www.hindustantimes.com/. January 6, 2018. Retrieved January 6, 2018.-

Data.event_text: - Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad states that the government was committed to freedom of the press, amid criticism of press censorship after UIDAI filed an FIR against a journalist of The Tribune for exposing illegal data access to Aadhaar database.

links.text: -"Aadhaar 'data breach': govt. committed to freedom of press, says Ravi Shankar Prasad". The Hindu. PTI. January 8, 2018. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved January 9, 2018.-
-"Aadhaar 'data breach': govt. committed to freedom of press, says Ravi Shankar Prasad". The Hindu. PTI. January 8, 2018. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved January 9, 2018.-

Data.event_text: - Supreme Court of India made playing the National Anthem of India in movie halls not mandatory, reversing its earlier order after the Indian Central Government opposed the move and formed a committee to form guidelines about the issue.

links.text: -Rajagopal, Krishnadas (January 9, 2018). "SC modifies order, says playing of national anthem in cinema halls was not mandatory". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved January 9, 2018.-
-Rajagopal, Krishnadas (January 9, 2018). "SC modifies order, says playing of national anthem in cinema halls was not mandatory". The Hindu. ISSN 0971-751X. Retrieved January 9, 2018.-

Data.event_text: - Government of India abolishes Haj subsidy.

links.text: -"Haj subsidy cancelled: All you need to know about the 85-year-old policy". The Indian Express. January 16, 2018. Retrieved April 25, 2022.-

Data.event_text: - Bellandur Lake, a heavily polluted lake in Bangalore city caught fire and burned for nearly 30 hours.

links.text: -"Bengaluru's Bellandur lake catches fire, causing worry among residents". mint. January 19, 2018. Retrieved January 19, 2022.-

Data.event_text: - India won 2018 Blind Cricket World Cup.
- President suspended the membership of Vidhan Sabha of 20 MLAs of Delhi Government under the Office of Profit.
- Attacks on Uttar Pradeshi and Bihari migrants in Maharashtra following clashes between workers of Maharashtra Navnirman Sena and Samajwadi Party at Dadar.
- A statue of Vladimir Lenin knocked down in Belonia, Tripura following end of 25 year long Communist Party of India (Marxist) rule in the state.

links.text: -Scroll Staff. "Tripura: Lenin statue knocked down in Belonia town, Left blames BJP workers". Scroll.in. Retrieved January 23, 2022.-

Data.event_text: - Kisan Long March, Maharashtra reached Mumbai. Nearly 30,000 farmers under the aegis of All India Kisan Sabha marched to Mumbai for loan waiver and implementation of M. S. Swaminathan Commission recommendations.

links.text: -"Farmers' long march to Mumbai: 5 things to know about the protest". www.dailyo.in. Retrieved January 19, 2022.-

Data.event_text: -  caste protests in India
- 2018 Tamil Nadu protests for Kaveri water sharing
- IRNSS-1I successfully launched from Satish Dhawan Space Centre.
- Thoothukudi violence
- 2018 Karbi Anglong lynching taken place due to Fake news spread through WhatsApp.
Government report warns that in 21 cities groundwater will run out by the year 2020.

links.text: -Scroll Staff. "Video: 21 Indian cities will run out of groundwater in 2 years, says a government report". Scroll.in.-

Data.event_text: - Burari deaths in Delhi.
- Enforcement Directorate files its first charge sheet in 2013 Vyapam scam against alleged master mind Dr. Jagadish Sagar.
- Prime Minister, Narendra Modi wins a no confidence motion in the Lok Sabha.

links.text: -"No-confidence motion against NDA govt rejected. Day's highlights". Livemint. July 20, 2018. Retrieved July 20, 2018.-

Data.event_text: 20  Heavy rainfall causes the 2018 Kerala floods. It was the worst flood to hit the state in a century.

Former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee dies at 93. He was the first Indian prime minister who was not a member of the Indian National Congress party to have served a full five-year term in office.
At least five people died and 30 were injured when a passenger train derailed in the north Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.

Data.event_text: - Amritsar train disaster

to 27  India Mobile Congress 2018, a 3 days event, was inaugurated by the Minister of State (independent charge) for Communications and Minister of State for Railways, Manoj Sinha, at Aerocity, New Delhi. The second edition of the iconic India Mobile Congress event saw the participation of 20 countries, 65000 visitors, 10000 delegates, 150 exhibitors, 300 international speakers and was supported by several ministries from the Government of India.

links.text: -"Day One-Indian Mobile Congress 2018, IMC 2018 Began On A Grand-Scale At Aero City, New Delhi. A Report". Communications Today. Archived from the original on September 11, 2020. Retrieved March 11, 2019.-

Data.event_text: - Prime Minister of India inaugurates world tallest statue, Statue of Unity at Gujarat.
